title: Jennifer Lopez seen filming new romcom Marry Me
text:
Her new film Hustlers has been a box office hit and has earned rave reviews from critics.

But Jennifer Lopez certainly hasn't wasted any time getting back to work since she was spotted on the set of her new romantic comedy, Marry Me, on Monday.

The 50-year-old singer and actress wrapped up in a white bathrobe as she left the Plaza Hotel in Manhattan, New York City ahead of a busy day of filming.

Back at work: Jennifer Lopez certainly hasn't wasted any time getting back to work since she was spotted on the set of her new romantic comedy, Marry Me, in New York City on Monday

JLo, who is starring in the film alongside Owen Wilson and Maluma, sported an all-white ensemble underneath her dressing gown.

She looked elegant in a white shirt and matching trousers, set off with coordinating the peep-toe heels.

The superstar's hair was pulled back in a tight ponytail and she wore a pair of dazzling statement earrings.

The script is based on the graphic novel of the same name by Bobby Crosby about a pop singer whose world is thrown upside down after she learns that her rocker boyfriend has been cheating on her, just moments before they're set to tie the knot at Madison Square Garden.

On set: JLo, who is starring in the new film alongside Owen Wilson and Maluma, sported an all-white ensemble underneath her dressing gown

After a meltdown on stage, Jennifer's character picks a random person out of the audience to marry instead.

The lucky man is Owen's maths teacher character, who happens to be holding a sign reading 'Marry Me.'

The film is a return to form for the If You Had My Love singer, who starred in romantic comedy hits like Maid In Manhattan and The Wedding Planner early in her career.

The shoot also comes after a break from film for Owen Wilson, who hasn't appeared in a movie since 2017's Father Figures.

Smart: She looked elegant in a white shirt and matching trousers, set off with coordinating the peep-toe heels

The duo re reunited in the film, after starring in the 1997 film Anaconda together.

Owen recently finished shooting his longtime collaborator Wes Anderson's upcoming movie The French Dispatch, which is expected in January 2020.

Meanwhile, in a new 17-minute documentary, Jennifer broke down in tears over the widespread critical acclaim for her new movie Hustlers.

The pop diva cried as her producing partner Elaine Goldsmith-Thomas - whom she's worked with since 1998 - read off review headlines over FaceTime.

Romcom: The script is based on the graphic novel of the same name by Bobby Crosby about a pop singer whose world is thrown upside down after she learns that her rocker boyfriend has been cheating on her

'I am so proud,' the Nuyorican CEO told the Golden Globe nominee on Sunday morning after the TIFF world premiere. 'Nobody knows how hard it was!'

At that, Jennifer was overcome with emotion and replied: 'I know baby, me too! I know, it's awesome!'

Critics have called Lopez's turn as veteran stripper/crime ringleader Ramona Vega in the 87% 'certified fresh' flick, her Erin Brockovich moment.

Ramona is based on stripper Samantha Barbash - who plead guilty to conspiracy, assault, and grand larceny in exchange for five years probation in 2017 for scamming Wall Street clients out of hundreds of thousands of dollars.
